messages.content: What is the purpose of the ComfyUI_DiT repository?
The ComfyUI_DiT repository was created to provide a platform for testing DiT (Denoising Diffusion-based Image Translation) models.
Is the ComfyUI_DiT repository stable and ready for use?
No, the ComfyUI_DiT repository is not stable and users should expect breaking changes if they choose to use it.
Where is the recommended place to find DiT support now?
The recommended place to find DiT support is in the ExtraModels repository located at https://github.com/city96/ComfyUI_ExtraModels.
What is the basis for much of the code in the ComfyUI_DiT repository?
A lot of the code in the ComfyUI_DiT repository is based on the original Meta (Facebook) DiT repository.
Where can the license for the original Meta DiT code be found in the ComfyUI_DiT repository?
The license for the original Meta DiT code can be found under the LICENSE-DiT file in the ComfyUI_DiT repository.
DiT stands for Denoising Diffusion-based Image Translation.
Is the ComfyUI_DiT repository actively maintained?
No, the ComfyUI_DiT repository is an old repo and is no longer actively maintained. Users are directed to the ExtraModels repository instead for DiT support.
